title: Of The Father's Love Begotten
author: Aurelius Clemens Prudentius (348-circa 413); Translated by John Mason Neale (1818-1866)

v1: Ere the worlds began to be,
He the source, the ending He,
Of the things that are and have been,
And that future years shall see,
v2: This is He whom they in old time
Whom the voices of the prophets
v3: O ye heights of heav'n adore Him;
And extol our Lord and King!
Let no tongue on earth be silent,
v4: Christ, to Thee, with God the Father,
And, O Holy Ghost, to Thee,
Hymn and chant and high thanksgiving,
